snippet: Budget cuts, inevitable strikes and protests and fears of terrorism are adding to the sense of dread among the French.
abstract: Mira Kamdar Editorial Observer holds that France's fall season, which typically brings a number of unpopular government proposals and resulting demonstrations, has been a particularly unhappy one this year; observes that miserable weather, budget cuts, strikes and fears of terrorism have all contributed to a sense of dread in the country.
lead_paragraph: Budget cuts, inevitable strikes and protests and fears of terrorism are adding to the sense of dread among the French.

headline.print_headline: After a Dreary Summer, Autumn Chill in France
headline.main: After a Dreary Summer, Autumn Chill in France
